CatDescriptText: Mrs. Donna Paroline, student, Bridgeville and Mr. Edward Noel, soldier-to-be, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 7  with question: "Do you think the United States should go to war with Russia over Berlin?"   Mrs. Paroline's answer reads: "No, Our country should try to maintain peace, but if we're forced, we should go for broke."  Mr. Noel's answer reads: "No, not unless they (Russia) wanted to start a war.  I think they are afraid to start one and so are we.  We're afraid of each other because of the number of bombs each one has..."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Donna Paroline wearing light colored button down collared shirt with short sleeves and breast pocket, standing in front of ribbed metal wall; Portrait of Edward Noel wearing dark sweater with argyle band, standing in front of ribbed metal wall
